comment: Alcohol on the nose. Nice amount of heat. Lots of cinnamon on palate and finish. This was a  PA Wine and Spirits barrel pick. Enjoyed it, but $80 is steep for a 4 year-old bourbon.

Nose of simple cinnamon apple, with a slight hint of mahogany in the background. Alcohol forward but creamy initial taste, as your tongue warms a hint of leather and citrus follows up the Virgin American Oak and then dissipates as you swallow. Leaving an incredibly smooth creamy aftertaste.
Little hot up front smooth back end

Nose: heavy caramel. Tiny bit of spice. No burn. 
Palate: little more bite than I was hoping from alcohol. Good sweet flavor after the initial burn though. Definitely young but still very good
Finish: short kinda sweet kinda spicy finish
Just isn’t my thing. Many like it, disappointing IMO.
Not the best notes and flavor. Very popular despite the SB bottle I have. Not a huge fan
